intro: Oryctanthus botryostachyus, commonly known as the sweet-scented sandthorn, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, characterized by its spiny stems and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are edible and have a sweet, tangy flavor. Its botanical features include alternate leaves with a rough texture and a distinctive, aromatic scent. Oryctanthus botryostachyus is adapted to survive in harsh environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
